title: VPMOVQW/VPMOVSQW/VPMOVUSQW â€” Down Convert QWord to Word

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPMOVQW xmm1/m32 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVSQW xmm1/m32 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVUSQW xmm1/m32 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVQW xmm1/m64 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVSQW xmm1/m64 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVUSQW xmm1/m64 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVQW xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, zmm2`
`VPMOVSQW xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, zmm2`
`VPMOVUSQW xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, zmm2`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: VPMOVQW down converts 64-bit integer elements in the source operand (the second operand) into packed words using truncation. VPMOVSQW converts signed 64-bit integers into packed signed words using signed saturation. VPMOVUSQW convert unsigned quad-word values into unsigned word values using unsigned saturation.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The destination operand is a XMM register or a 128/64/32-bit memory location.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Down-converted word elements are written to the destination operand (the first operand) from the least-significant word. Word elements of the destination operand are updated according to the writemask. Bits (MAXVL-1:128/64/32) of the register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
